Subject: separating test data from test code.

MIME-Version: 1.0
X-Mailer: Internet Mail Service (5.5.2653.19)
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
From: "Laird, William" <blaird@...>

I'm a QA weenie, with a coding background. I will be using JUnit as a
framework to do API testing for an API that other developers wrote. I would
like to keep test data separate from the test code. I could see this test
data being read from an XML file, or quite possibly being retrieved from a
database via JDBC, or both. 

I'm wondering if there has been any discussion on this, or if anyone knows
of any extensions that have already "invented the wheel" in this area. I've
looked at JXUnit, but it seems as if the learning curve is a bit too much
for me to take it on right now. 

Thanks, 
Bill Laird


BTW, if there are any yahoo groups administrators reading this... please
take my membership status from "pending" to "approved" in the yahoo
groups... thanks.
subject: separating test data from test code.
